Kindergarten | First Grade | Second Grade | Third Grade | Fourth Grade | Fifth Grade

Kindergarten

Items to be Labeled with Name

  • A large backpack- please label name on the inside.
  • Two 2-pocket folders (plastic folders last longer). Please label it with your child’s name and teacher.
  • Plastic bag with an extra set of clothing, including socks and underwear. Please label the bag and clothes with the students’ name. These clothes will need to be changed with the season.

Items with No Name Label (Community Supplies)

  • 1 box of sharpened #2 pencils.
  • 1 box of tissues.
  • 1-2 package(s) of baby wipes

First Grade

Items to be Labeled with Name

  • 1 Box of crayons
  • 1 Box of colored pencils
  • 2 Plastic pocket folders- free choice (no solid blue or solid green please)
  • 1 Pair of headphones (no earbuds or cordless ones please. Needs to be compatible with iPad)
  • 1 Pencil/Crayon box- please no pencil bags with zippers or boxes with keys

Items with No Name Label

  • 1 Box of markers fine tip or wide tip
  • 1 Box of tissues
  • *Optional – Ziploc bags- box of quart (from girls) or gallon (from boys)
  • *Optional – Hand Sanitizer (Purell only)

Ms. Dawes Connections Class (Grades K, 1, and 2)

  • 2 packs black fine low odor dry erase makers
  • 1 white glue bottle
  • 3-5 glue sticks
  • 2 pocket folders
  • 4-5 boxes of tissues
  • 3-4 packages of baby wipes
  • 4 rolls of paper towels
  • *Plastic bag with an extra set of clothing, including socks and underwear (names on tags please).
  • *If your child is in diapers or pull ups, please send in a supply.

  • *We have morning and afternoon snacks daily. Donations of animal crackers, goldfish crackers, Cheez-its, pretzels, or your child’s favorite snack are greatly appreciated for children who forget snacks.

Second Grade

  • Three dozen sharpened pencils- Ticonderoga brand please, they last the longest!
  • USB-C headphones
  • 1 average size box of tissues
  • 2 large glue sticks
  • 1 pair of scissors – child sized
  • Pop-top water bottle

If Possible, Materials to Share

  • Band-Aids
  • Emergency snacks – saltines, pretzels, goldfish (nut free)

Third Grade

Please label these items with NAME

  • Scissors
  • 1 set of headphones (in a Ziploc bag labeled with name)
  • 1 composition notebook

These items should not be labeled

  • 2 dozen sharpened #2 pencils (Ticonderoga if possible)
  • 1 pack of 5 low odor Expo dry erase markers
  • 2 extra-large Elmer’s glue sticks
  • 1 box of Puff’s tissues 
  • 2 Pink Pearl large erasers
  • Colored Pencils

    Fourth Grade

    • 1 folder that will serve as your go-home folder. We would appreciate a laminated or plastic folder as it lasts much longer. Please label it “Go-Home Folder” along with your child’s first and last name
    • One box of colored pencils
    • Handheld pencil sharpener (must fit inside your pencil pouch)
    • Glue sticks (pack of 6 or larger)
    • 4 dozen sharpened pencils (Ticonderoga pencils are the most durable)
    • 1 one-subject notebook. Please label it with your child’s first and last name
    • 2 boxes of tissues to share as community supplies
    • One box of Expo markers (fine tip, black)
    • Highlighters (4-5, any color)
    • 1 box of graham crackers (community supplies for the emergency snack fund)
    • Fully closable water bottle (*Optional – labeled with first and last name)

    Fifth Grade

    • Pre-sharpened pencils (Ticonderoga pencils)
    • 2 Sharpies
    • Highlighters
    • 12-inch ruler
    • Extra erasers
    •  4 bottom-pocket folders in solid colors – clearly labeled with student name and the following headings:
      • 1 BLUE (Math)
      • 1 RED (ELA)
      • 1 YELLOW (Science /Social Studies)
      • 1 GREEN (Go Home Folder)
    • 2 boces of tissues
    • Markers
    • Post-it notes – any size
    • Community snack donations (graham crackers)

    Ms. Rudd’s Connections Class (Grades 3, 4 & 5)

    • 2 packs black fine low odor dry erase makers
    • 1 white glue bottle
    • 3-5 glue sticks
    • 2 pocket folders
    • 4-5 boxes of tissues
    • 3-4 packages of baby wipes
    • 4 rolls of paper towels
    • *Plastic bag with an extra set of clothing, including socks and underwear (names on tags please).
    • *If your child is in diapers or pull ups, please send in a supply.
    • *We have morning and afternoon snacks daily. Donations of animal crackers, goldfish crackers, Cheez-its, pretzels, or your child’s favorite snack are greatly appreciated for children who forget snacks.
    • Please send in the following items with your Childs name on each item: toothbrush, toothpaste (RUDD’S CLASS ONLY)
